section.title: Prerequisites for test execution
section.para: To be able to start a test you must:

listitem.para: Create a Test Suite ().
Add Test Cases to be executed to the Test Suite ()
Define an AUT ().
Configure an AUT () if you want to start the AUT from the ITE.
Choose an AUT for the Test Suite ().
Set the working language to the language you want to execute the test in.
Connect to the AUT Agent ().
Start the AUT () (either from the ITE or using the autrun command).
Complete object mapping ().
Make sure that your test data is complete in your Test Cases.

para.para: It is a good idea to set your preferences for test results in the preferences dialog () before test execution.

section.title: Starting the AUT
section.para: To start the AUT, you must:

listitem.para: have defined an AUT ()
have connected to the AUT Agent ()
if you want to start your AUT from the ITE, and not using the autrun option, then you must have configured an AUT ()

para.para: You can only start AUTs from the ITE which support the current working language. Change the working language if necessary by selecting a language from the list next to the language button on the toolbar.

listitem.para: On the toolbar, click on the arrow next to the ”Start AUT” button .
Select an AUT and the configuration to start it with from the list.
The AUT will be started in the current working language.
Clicking directly on the ”Start AUT” button will start the most recently started AUT (marked with a tick in the list of AUTs and configurations).

section.para:
Once the AUT has been started, it will appear in the running AUTs view.
Further information on starting specific types of AUT is available in the toolkit-specific details ().

section.title: Starting, stopping and pausing Test Suites and Test Jobs
Starting a Test Suite or a Test Job
section.para: To start a Test Suite or a Test Job, you must:

listitem.para: have started the AUT ()
have completed object mapping for the Test Suite or Test Suites ()
have entered complete test data for your Test Suites, for the language you want the test to run in.

para.para: Before starting a Test Suite or a Test Job, it is a good idea to review your preferences for the test results ().

listitem.para: You can start a Test Suite from the Test Suite Browser or from the Running AUTs View. Click on the arrow next to the ”Start test execution” button and select a Test Suite to start from the list.
You can start a Test Job from the Test Suite Browser. Click on the arrow next to the ”start test execution” button and select a Test Job to start from the list.

para.para: The amount of Test Suites or Test Jobs in the list for the ”start test” button depends on your selection. In the Running AUTs View, only Test Suites for the currently selected AUT will be shown. In the Test Suite Browser, if you have selected a Test Suite or a Test Job, only the selected item will be startable.

section.para: When a test is running, you can view the progress of the test in the Progress View. This is especially useful if the ITE and the AUT are running on different machines: you can see how much longer the test will run without having to switch to the machine the AUT is running on.

section.title: Stopping a Test Suite or Test Job
section.para: To stop the test at any point, click on the ”stop test execution” button on the toolbar. The test stops automatically when it finishes or when an error occurs whose Event Handler has exit as a reentry type.

section.title: Pausing a Test Suite or Test Job

listitem.para: To pause a test, click on the ”pause test execution” button on the main toolbar.

To continue with the test, press the ”Pause test execution” button again.
You can opt to automatically pause the test execution when an error occurs via the toolbar ().
If the client and AUT Agent are installed on the same machine, moving the mouse will disrupt the test.

section.title: Interactive test analysis
section.para: If you are executing tests interactively, you can use the ITE to help you analyze any errors that occur.

section.title: Pause on Error
section.para: On the toolbar in the ITE, click the ”Pause on Test Execution Errors” button or press »F9« to cause the test to pause when it encounters an error.

para.para: Failed Test Steps that have a retry Event Handler will not be paused unless the final retry fails.

section.title: Continuing after an error
section.para: Once you have analyzed the error in the AUT or in the test specification, you have two options:

listitem.para: Press the ”Pause test execution” button on the toolbar () to continue with the test. This will result in a Event Handler (either a default Event Handler or one of your own) being activated.

Press the ”Continue without Event Handler” button or »F8« to continue with the test as if the failed Test Step had been successful. No Event Handler is activated. This option is useful if the Event Handler that would be activated would restart the AUT or exit the test, but you are either able to ignore the error for the moment or make changes in the AUT to ensure that the test will be able to continue.

para.para: Any changes you make to the test specification while the test is paused will not become valid until the next test execution start.

section.title: Altering the speed of test execution
section.para: You can slow down the speed of test execution to be able to watch your tests by entering a step delay in the Properties View for the Test Suite ().
